module.name: InterfaceBase
module.short: Provides a platform-independent widgetset class and helper functions.

descr.p: interfacebase.pp contains classes, types, and routines used to define a platform-independent widgetset class (TWidgetSet) and helper functions.
This file is part of the Lazarus Component Library (LCL).

element.name: PEventHandler
element.short: Pointer to an event handler routine.

descr.p: PEventHandler is an alias to the Pointer type. It is used in widgetset class to add or remove event handlers in the class instance.

element.name: PProcessEventHandler
element.short: Pointer to a process event handler routine.

descr.p: PProcessEventHandler is an alias to the Pointer type. It is used in widgetset class to add or remove process event handlers in the class instance.

element.name: PPipeEventHandler
element.short: Pointer to a pipe event handler routine.

descr.p: PPipeEventHandler is an alias to the Pointer type. It is used in widgetset class to add or remove pipe event handlers in the class instance.

element.name: PSocketEventHandler
element.short: Pointer to a socket event handler routine.

descr.p: PSocketEventHandler is an alias to the Pointer type. It is used in widgetset class to add or socket event handlers in the class instance.

element.name: TChildExitReason
element.short: Represents reasons that a child process was exited.

descr.p: TChildExitReason is an enumerated type with values that represent reasons a child process was exited. TChildExitReason values are passed as a parameter to TChildExitEvent event handler routines, and used in the TAsyncProcess.HandleProcessTermination method which implements the event handler.

element.name: TChildExitReason.cerExit
element.short: Child process was exited normally.

element.name: TChildExitReason.cerSignal
element.short: Child process was terminated by a signal.

element.name: TPipeReason
element.short: Represents reasons that a pipe event was signalled.

descr.p: TPipeReason is an enumerated type with values that represent reasons a pipe event was signalled. TPipeReason values are passed as a parameter to TPipeEvent event handler routines used in WidgetSet classes.

element.name: TPipeReason.prDataAvailable
element.short: Data is available as input for the pipe.

element.name: TPipeReason.prBroken
element.short: The pipe was closed or did not provide expected data.

element.name: TPipeReason.prCanWrite
element.short: Data is available to be written as output.

element.name: TPipeReasons
element.short: Set type used to store values from TPipeReason.

element.name: TApplicationMainLoop
element.short: Represents the main processing loop in an application.

descr.p: TApplicationMainLoop is an object procedure type which represents the main processing loop for an application. TApplicationMainLoop is the type passed as an argument to the TWidgetSet.AppRun method.

element.name: TWaitHandleEvent
element.short: Specifies an event handler signalled for the handle in an interface object.

descr.p: TWaitHandleEvent is an object procedure which specifies an event handler signalled for the handle in an interface object. The parameters contain a pointer to the data and flag values used in the event notification. It provides a callback routine executed when the signal occurs on the handle.
TWaitHandleEvent is passed as an argument to the TWidgetSet.AddEventHandler method.

element.name: TWaitHandleEvent.AData
element.short: Integer pointer to the data for the event.

element.name: TWaitHandleEvent.AFlags
element.short: Flag value(s) for the event notification.

element.name: TChildExitEvent
element.short: Specifies an event handler signalled when a child process is exited.

descr.p: TChildExitEvent is an object precedure type which specifies an event handler signalled when a child process is exited in a widgetset object. The parameters provide a pointer to the event data, the reason the process was exited, and a unique identifier for the event.
TChildExitEvent is the type passed as an argument to the TWidgetSet.AddProcessEventHandler method.

element.name: TChildExitEvent.AData
element.short: Pointer to the data for the event.

element.name: TChildExitEvent.AReason
element.short: Reason the process was exited.

element.name: TChildExitEvent.AInfo
element.short: Unique identifier for the event notification.

element.name: TPipeEvent
element.short: Specifies an event handler signalled for a pipe handle in a widgetset object.

descr.p: TPipeEvent is an object procedure type which specifies an event handler signalled for a pipe handle in a widgetset object. It is used for asynchronous process event notifications. The parameters contain a pointer to the data for the event, and the reason for the event notification.
TPipeEvent is the type passed as an argument to the TWidgetSet.AddPipeEventHandler method.

element.name: TPipeEvent.AData
element.short: Pointer to the data for the event notification.

element.name: TPipeEvent.AReasons
element.short: Reason for the event notification.

element.name: TSocketEvent
element.short: Specifies an event handler signalled for a socket handle in a widgetset object.

descr.p: TSocketEvent is an object procedure type which specifies an event handler signalled for a socket handle in a widgetset object.

notes.note: Cannot find a use case. Redeclared in widgetset classes.

element.name: TSocketEvent.AData
element.short: Pointer to the data for the event notification.

element.name: TSocketEvent.AFlags
element.short: Flag values for the event notification.

element.name: TLCLWndMethod
element.short: The type used for all LCL message handlers.

element.name: TLCLCapability
element.short: Represents capabilities used in the LCL.
element.descr: TLCLCapability is an enumerated type with values that represent capabilities used in the Lazarus Component Library (LCL). The enumeration values identify features or behaviors that may be implemented in a given widgetset object. The enumeration values can be passed to the TWidgetSet.GetLCLCapability method to determine whether the feature or behavior is implemented for the platform.

element.name: TLCLCapability.lcAsyncProcess
element.short: Supports asynchronous processes.

element.name: TLCLCapability.lcCanDrawOutsideOnPaint
element.short: Supports drawing outside of the OnPaint event for a control.

element.name: TLCLCapability.lcNeedMininimizeAppWithMainForm
element.short: When the main form is minimized, the application is minimized too.

element.name: TLCLCapability.lcApplicationTitle
element.short: Can change application title at run-time.

element.name: TLCLCapability.lcApplicationWindow
element.short: Application has a special root window.

element.name: TLCLCapability.lcFormIcon
element.short: Forms have an icon.

element.name: TLCLCapability.lcModalWindow
element.short: Has native modal window support.

element.name: TLCLCapability.lcDragDockStartOnTitleClick
element.short: Can drag-dock forms by clicking on the title bar.

element.name: TLCLCapability.lcAntialiasingEnabledByDefault
element.short: amDontCare is the same as amOn for the widgetset.

element.name: TLCLCapability.lcLMHelpSupport
element.short: Has support for the LM_HELP command.

element.name: TLCLCapability.lcReceivesLMClearCutCopyPasteReliably
element.short: Carbon does not receive LM_CLEAR, LM_CUT, LM_COPY, LM_PASTE reliably; this affects DB controls.

element.name: TLCLCapability.lcSendsUTF8KeyPress
element.short: The interface sends UTF8KeyPress directly. When not available, it will be emulated in TWinControl.CNChar.

element.name: TLCLCapability.lcAllowChildControlsInNativeControls
element.short: Used by the LCL custom-drawn widgetset so that it can inject child controls in native ones.

element.name: TLCLCapability.lcEmulatedMDI
element.short: Provides emulation of MDI commands for widgetsets which do not provide native MDI handling.

element.name: TLCLCapability.lcAccessibilitySupport
element.short: Indicates accessibility is implemented; mostly for TCustomControl descendents as native widgetsets should have in-built accessibility.

element.name: TLCLCapability.lcRadialGradientBrush
element.short: Indicates that CreateBrushWithRadialGradient is supported to create a brush with a radial gradient pattern.

element.name: TLCLCapability.lcTransparentWindow
element.short: Has the ability to pass mouse messages through a window (on win32 LM_NCHITTEST with HTTRANSPARENT result).

element.name: TLCLCapability.lcTextHint
element.short: Has native TextHint support.

element.name: TLCLCapability.lcNativeTaskDialog
element.short: Task dialogs on MS Windows for widgetsets different than win32/wince. Used in LCLTaskDialog. Qt/Qt5 must set this option to False otherwise taskdialog segfaults.

element.name: TLCLCapability.lcCanDrawHidden
element.short: The system rendering engine might request a hidden control to be drawn (macOS 10.9 and later).

element.name: TLCLCapability.lcAccelleratorKeys
element.short: Supports UI accelerator keys using & as a prefix for the accelerator character.

element.name: TDialogButton
element.short: Implements a standard dialog button.

descr.p: TDialogButton is a TCollectionItem descendant which implements a standard dialog button.
TDialogButton is the type created and stored in the TDialogButtons Collection. An overridden method is provided to use the Caption as the DisplayName for the collection item.
TDialogButton contains properties used to control how a dialog button button is displayed and used.
Caption contains the text displayed on the button face, and can define an accelerator key by prefixing a character with an Ampersand (&).
Cancels indicate if the dialog button is used as the Cancel button in the Collection.
Default indicates if the dialog button is the default button in the Collection.

element.name: TDialogButton.GetDisplayName
element.short: Gets the value for the DisplayName property.

descr.p: GetDisplayName is an overridden method in TDialogButton and uses the value in the Caption property as the name displayed for the collection item.

element.name: TDialogButton.GetDisplayName.Result
element.short: Display name for the collection item.

element.name: TDialogButton.SetCaption
element.short: Sets the value for the Caption property.

element.name: TDialogButton.SetCaption.AValue
element.short: New value for the properly.

element.name: TDialogButton.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Create is the overridden constructor for the class instance, and calls the inherited method on entry.
ACollection is the TCollection instance which owns the new dialog button. It is assigned to the Collection property in the colleciton item.
Create sets the default values for the Caption and ModalResult properties.

element.name: TDialogButton.Create.ACollection
element.short: Collection which owns the collection item.

element.name: TDialogButton.Caption
element.short: Value displayed on the button face.

descr.p: Caption is a String property with the value displayed on the button face for the dialog button. The value in Caption is also used as the DisplayName for the collection item in the TDialogButtons collection.

element.name: TDialogButton.Cancel
element.short: True if the button is the Cancel button.

descr.p: Cancel is a Boolean property which indicates if the button is used as the Cancel button in the dialog.

Cancel is True when the button instance is the value assigned to the CancelButton property in TDialogButtons collection. Setting a new value in Cancel causes the CancelButton property in TDialogButtons to be updated accordingly.
Use Default to control whether the button is the default button for the dialog.
Use ModalResult to set the value returned when the button is clicked.

element.name: TDialogButton.Default
element.short: True if the button is the default button.

descr.p: Default is a Boolean property which indicates if the button is the default button for the dialog.

Default is True when the button instance is the value assigned to the DefaultButton property in the TDialogButtons Collection. Setting a new value in Default causes the DefaultButton property in TDialogButtons to be updated accordingly.
Use Cancel to control whether the button is used as the Cancel button in the dialog.
Use ModalResult to set the value returned when the button is clicked.

element.name: TDialogButton.ModalResult
element.short: The modal result value returned when the button is clicked.

descr.p: ModalResult is a LongInt property which contains the modal result value returned when the button is clicked in the dialog.
ModalResult values correspond to the values in the TModalResult enumeration, but use the native data type expected in TWidgetSet methods.

element.name: TDialogButtons
element.short: Collection used to store TDialogButton instances.

descr.p: TDialogButtons is a TCollection descendant used to create and maintain the TDialogButton instances in the Items for the collection.
TDialogButtons re-implements methods like GetItem, SetItem, and Add to use the TDialogButton class type when adding or accessing the Items in the collection.
The FindButton method can be used to find a dialog button in the collection which has specific modal result value(s).
Use the DefaultButton and CancelButton properties to access the button instances used for the corresponding purpose in the collection.
TDialogButtons is the type passed as a parameter to the TWidgetSet.AskUser method.

element.name: TDialogButtons.GetItem
element.short: Gets the value for the indexed Items property.

element.name: TDialogButtons.GetItem.Result
element.short: Value for the indexed property.

element.name: TDialogButtons.GetItem.Index
element.short: Ordinal position for the collection item in the property.

element.name: TDialogButtons.SetCancelButton
element.short: Sets the value for the CancelButton property.

element.name: TDialogButtons.SetCancelButton.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TDialogButtons.SetDefaultButton
element.short: Sets the value for the DefaultButton property.

element.name: TDialogButtons.SetDefaultButton.Value
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TDialogButtons.SetItem
element.short: Sets the value in the indexed Items property.

element.name: TDialogButtons.SetItem.Index
element.short: Ordinal position for the new value in the Items property.

element.name: TDialogButtons.SetItem.Value
element.short: New value stored in the indexed Items property.

element.name: TDialogButtons.Add
element.short: Adds a new button instance to the Items in the collection.

descr.p: Add is an overridden TDialogButton function in TDialogButtons used to add a new button instance to the Items in the collection. Add ensures that the value returned from the inherited Add method is cast to the TDialogButton type used in Items.

element.name: TDialogButtons.Add.Result
element.short: TDialogButton instance created and stored in the Items for the collection.

element.name: TDialogButtons.FindButton
element.short: Finds the button associated with (one of) the given modal result values.

descr.p: FindButton is an overloaded TDialogButton function used to locate a dialog button in the collection which uses the specified modal result value. Overloaded variants are provided which accept one or multiple modal result values to locate in the method.
AModalResult contains the modal result value to locate in the collection Items.
AOrder allows an array of modal resuilt values to be located in the method. It specifies the search order for the modal result values.

FindButton iterates over the Items in the collection to find the first button which uses the modal result value(s). The return value is the first TDialogButton instance in Items which matches the requested value(s).

element.name: TDialogButtons.FindButton.Result
element.short: Dialog button which uses the modal result value.

element.name: TDialogButtons.FindButton.AModalResult
element.short: The modal result value for the button located in the method.

element.name: TDialogButtons.FindButton.Order
element.short: List of modal result values to find in the collection.

element.name: TDialogButtons.DefaultButton
element.short: The default button for the dialog.

descr.p: DefaultButton is a TDialogButton property which contains the dialog button which has its Default property set to True.

The property value is assigned when the Default property for a TDialogButton instance in the collection is changed. When Default (in the button) is changed to True, it is stored in DefaultButton. When Default (in the button) is set to False, the value in DefaultButton is set to Nil. It is assumed that a another button will be designated as the default button.
Use CancelButton for the button with its Cancel property set to True.

element.name: TDialogButtons.CancelButton
element.short: The cancel button for the dialog.

element.name: TDialogButtons.Items
element.short: Provides indexed access to the dialog buttons in the collection.

descr.p: Items is an indexed TDialogButton property used to access to a dialog button by its ordinal position in the Items for the collection. Read and write access to the property value is re-implemented in TDialogButtons to use the TDialogButton type for the collection item in the property value.
Use Count to get the number of dialog buttons stored in Items.
Use Add to create and store a new TDialogButtoon instance in Items.
Use Delete to remove a collection item at a specific position in Items.
Use Clear to remove all Items in the collection.

element.name: TDialogButtons.Items.Index
element.short: Ordinal position for the dialog button.

element.name: TWSTimerProc
element.short: Type used for a timer callback procedure.

element.name: TWidgetSet
element.short: Provides an application helper class (platform and drawing interface).

descr.p: TWidgetSet is a TObject descendant which implements an application helper class that provides access to platform-specific operating system and drawing interfaces. A number of methods are declared as abstract virtual, and must be implemented in descendent classes. Other methods are declared as virtual to allow them to be overridden for a specific platform.
TWidgetSet is used as the ancestor for platform-specific implementations like TWin32WidgetSet, TGTKWidgetSet, TQtWidgetSet, TCarbonWidgetSet, TCocoaWidgetSet, et. al.
The WidgetSet variable provides access to the TWidgetSet singleton for the current widgetset implementation.

element.name: TWidgetSet.PassCmdLineOptions
element.short: Passes commandline arguments needed for the platform.

descr.p: PassCmdLineOptions is a procedure used to pass commandline arguments used for the platform-specific widgetset implementation. PassCmdLineOptions has an empty implementation in TWidgetSet, and must be overridden in a descendent class. It allows commandline arguments to be preprocessed or modified prior to starting an application.

element.name: TWidgetSet.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Create is the constructor for the class instance, and calls the inherited method on entry. Create calls CreateThemeServices to allocate the TThemeServices instance used in the ThemeServices property.

element.name: TWidgetSet.BeforeDestruction
element.short: Performs actions needed before freeing the class instance.

descr.p: BeforeDestruction is an overridden method used to perform actions needed prior to freeing the class instance. BeforeDestruction ensures that resources allocated for the ThemeServices property are freed and nil'd. BeforeDestruction calls the inherited method prior to exit.

element.name: TWidgetSet.AppInit
element.short: Initializes the application for the platform, and returns Screen information.

descr.p: Called by Application.Initialize. Don't call this directly, the LCL will use it when adequate.

element.name: TWidgetSet.AppRun
element.short: Enters a state in which the application waits for system messages.

descr.p: Called by Application.Run. Don't call this directly, the LCL will use it when adequate.

element.name: TWidgetSet.AppRun.ALoop
element.short: Main processing loop for the application.

element.name: TWidgetSet.AppWaitMessage
element.short: Waits for arrival of a message.
element.descr: Don't call this directly, the LCL will use it when adequate.

element.name: TWidgetSet.AppProcessMessages
element.short: Handles all pending messages.

descr.p: Called by Application.ProcessMessages. Don't call this directly, the LCL will use it when adequate.

element.name: TWidgetSet.AppTerminate
element.short: Terminates the application.

descr.p: Called by Application.Terminate. Don't call this directly, the LCL will use it when adequate.

element.name: TWidgetSet.AppMinimize
element.short: Minimizes the whole application to the taskbar.

descr.p: Called by Application.Minimize. Don't call this directly, the LCL will use it when adequate.

element.name: TWidgetSet.AppRestore
element.short: Restore application previously minimized to the taskbar.

descr.p: Called by Application.Restore. Don't call this directly, the LCL will use it when adequate.

element.name: TWidgetSet.AppBringToFront
element.short: Brings the entire application on top of all other non-topmost programs.

descr.p: Called by Application.BringToFront. Don't call this directly, the LCL will use it when adequate.

element.name: TWidgetSet.AppSetIcon
element.short: Sets the icon in the taskbar.

descr.p: Don't call this directly, the LCL will use it when adequate.

element.name: TWidgetSet.AppSetTitle
element.short: Sets the title for an application.

descr.p: Don't call this directly, the LCL will use it when adequate.

element.name: TWidgetSet.AppSetVisible
element.short: Changes the visibility of the application window.

descr.p: Don't call this directly, the LCL will use it when adequate.

element.name: TWidgetSet.AppRemoveStayOnTopFlags
element.short: Resets all StayOnTop windows to NoTopmost.

descr.p: Don't call this directly, the LCL will use it when adequate.

element.name: TWidgetSet.AppRemoveStayOnTopFlags.Result
element.short: False on failure.

element.name: TWidgetSet.AppRestoreStayOnTopFlags
element.short: Sets all windows in the StayOnTop list to TopMost.

element.name: TWidgetSet.AppSetMainFormOnTaskBar
element.short: Shows or hides the taskbar icon for the MainForm.

element.name: TWidgetSet.AppSetMainFormOnTaskBar.DoSet
element.short: The visibility of the MainForm icon in the TaskBar.

element.name: TWidgetSet.LCLPlatform
element.short: Returns the name for the widgetset used for the platform.

element.name: TWidgetSet.LCLPlatform.Result
element.short: Widgetset in use for the platform.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetLCLCapability
element.short: Checks whether the widgetset supports the specified LCL capability.

descr.p: GetLCLCapability is a PtrUInt function used to determine if a specific LCL capability is supported in the widgetset implementation.
ACapability contains a TLCLCapability enumeration value examined in the method. The value identifies a feature or behavior in the LCL.
The return value is either LCL_CAPABILITY_NO or LCL_CAPABILITY_YES. LCL_CAPABILITY_YES indicates that the capabiity is implemented for the platform.

GetLCLCapability is overridden in descendent classes to return a value valid for the platform-specific implementation. The implementation in TWidgetSet handles the capabilities common to all widgetsets supported in the LCL. It is called when the descendent class does not handle the value in ACapability.
TWidgetSet returns LCL_CAPABILITY_YES for the following enumeration values:
All other enumeration values in TLCLCapability return LCL_CAPABILITY_NO.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetLCLCapability.Result
element.short: Can be either LCL_CAPABILITY_NO or LCL_CAPABILITY_YES.

element.name: TWidgetSet.GetLCLCapability.ACapability
element.short: TLCLCapability enumeration value checked in the method.

element.name: TWidgetSet.DCGetPixel
element.short: Gets the color for a pixel on the specified device context.

descr.p: Defined as an abstract virtual method. Must be implemented in a descendent class to use the image format and device context needed for the platform.

element.name: TWidgetSet.DCSetPixel
element.short: Sets the color for a pixel on the specified device context.

descr.p: Defined as an abstract virtual method. Must be implemented in a descendent class to use the image format and device context needed for the platform.

element.name: TWidgetSet.DCRedraw
element.short: Redraws the device context for the specified canvas handle.

descr.p: Used in the implementation of the TCanvas.RealizeAutoRedraw method called when its AutoRedraw property is changed.
Implemented for Gtk, Gtk2, Carbon, and Cocoa widgetsets.

element.name: TWidgetSet.DCRedraw.CanvasHandle
element.short: Canvas handle with the device context for the redraw operation.

element.name: TWidgetSet.DCSetAntialiasing
element.short: Enables or disables anti-aliasing for the specified device context.

descr.p: Called from the RealizeAntiAliasing method in TCanvas when its handle or AntialiasingMode property is changed.

element.name: TWidgetSet.DCSetAntialiasing.CanvasHandle
element.short: Canvas handle with the device context updated in the method.

element.name: TWidgetSet.DCSetAntialiasing.AEnabled
element.short: True to enable anti-aliasing for the device context.

element.name: TWidgetSet.InitStockFont
element.short: Initializes a font object to a (predefined) stock font.

element.name: TWidgetSet.InitStockFont.Result
element.short: False on failure.

element.name: TWidgetSet.InitStockFont.AFont
element.short: The font to initialize.

element.name: TWidgetSet.InitStockFont.AStockFont
element.short: The predefined font to use for the initialization.

element.name: TWidgetSet.IsHelpKey
element.short: Checks whether the widgetset uses the key to show help.

element.name: TWidgetSet.IsHelpKey.Result
element.short: True when this is a Help key.

element.name: TWidgetSet.IsHelpKey.Key
element.short: The virtual key.

element.name: TWidgetSet.IsHelpKey.Shift
element.short: The modifier key state.

element.name: TWidgetSet.CreateTimer
element.short: Creates a timer with the given callback method.

element.name: TWidgetSet.CreateTimer.Result
element.short: The timer ID, zero on failure.

element.name: TWidgetSet.CreateTimer.Interval
element.short: The time interval.

element.name: TWidgetSet.CreateTimer.TimerProc
element.short: The callback method.

element.name: TWidgetSet.DestroyTimer
element.short: Destroys a timer.

descr.p: Declared as an abstract virtual method in TWidgetSet. Must be implemented in a descendent class to use the platform-specific mechanism(s) required for the implementation.

element.name: TWidgetSet.DestroyTimer.Result
element.short: False on failure.

element.name: TWidgetSet.DestroyTimer.TimerHandle
element.short: The timer ID.

element.name: TWidgetSet.AppHandle
element.short: Native handle for a TApplication instance.

descr.p: AppHandle is a platform-specific property. The meaning and use for the handle changes from widgetset to widgetset.

element.name: TWidgetSet.Arc
element.short: Use Arc to draw an elliptically curved line with the current Pen.

descr.p: The arc is part of the ellipse inscribed in the bounding rectangle.

The angles angle1 and angle2 are 1/16th of a degree. For example, a full circle equals 5760 (16*360). Positive values of Angle and AngleLength mean counter-clockwise while negative values mean clockwise direction. Zero degrees is at the 3 o'clock position.

element.name: TWidgetSet.Arc.Result
element.short: False on failure.

element.name: TWidgetSet.Arc.Angle16Deg
element.short: base angle.

element.name: TWidgetSet.Arc.Angle16DegLength
element.short: angle length.

element.name: TWidgetSet.AngleChord
element.short: Use AngleChord to draw a filled Chord shape on a canvas.

descr.p: The chord is outlined with the current pen, and filled with the current brush.

The angles angle1 and angle2 are 1/16th of a degree. For example, a full circle equals 5760 16*360). Positive values of Angle and AngleLength mean counter-clockwise while negative values mean clockwise direction. Zero degrees is at the 3 o'clock position.

element.name: TWidgetSet.AngleChord.Result
element.short: False on failure.

element.name: TWidgetSet.AngleChord.angle1
element.short: Base angle.

element.name: TWidgetSet.AngleChord.angle2
element.short: Angle length.

element.name: TWidgetSet.BeginPaint
element.short: Start painting in a window.

descr.p: This function is for use in WM_PAINT handlers only. Not all platforms allow for painting outside WM_PAINT messages.
BeginPaint prepares the specified window for painting and fills a PAINTSTRUCT structure with information about the painting.

element.name: TWidgetSet.BeginPaint.Result
element.short: A Device Context for the window, Nil on failure.

element.name: TWidgetSet.BeginPaint.Handle
element.short: The window Handle.

element.name: TWidgetSet.BeginPaint.PS
element.short: Will receive painting information.

element.name: TWidgetSet.BitBlt
element.short: Copies part of a source DC into a destination DC, using the specified raster operation.

descr.p: This routine implements the equivalent Windows GDI API of the same name in all platforms supported by Lazarus.

It copies a section of a Canvas to another one, without any stretching. It allows one to select the kind of operation which should be performed to draw the pixels into the destination in the parameter ROP. Allowed operations go from simply copying the pixels without change to inverting them and also to executing logical operations involving the source pixels and the previously existing pixels in the destination Canvas.
For normal usage one should only use SRCOPY in the ROP parameter, other operations may not be supported by all widgetsets.
There exist 16 raster operations, according to the possible combinations of two (boolean) values. Excluding the NOP case, that doesn't modify the target area, the possible values for ROP are:

ul.li: BLACKNESS - Fills the destination rectangle with black
DSTINVERT - Inverts the colors of the destination area
SRCPAINT - Combines the colors of the source and the destination using the operator OR on each pixel
WHITENESS - Fills the destination rectangle with white

descr.p: These flags can be added to above ROPs:

dl.dd: Includes windows which are on top of the specified Canvas. This option is not recommended and is very hard to implement in all supported platforms.
Prevents the bitmap from being mirrored. (The coordinates are sorted before painting?)

element.name: TWidgetSet.BitBlt.Result
element.short: False on failure.

element.name: TWidgetSet.BitBlt.DestDC
element.short: The destination Device Context.

element.name: TWidgetSet.BitBlt.X
element.short: The origin in the destination DC.

element.name: TWidgetSet.BitBlt.Y
element.short: The origin in the destination DC.

element.name: TWidgetSet.BitBlt.Width
element.short: The image size.

element.name: TWidgetSet.BitBlt.Height
element.short: The image size.

element.name: TWidgetSet.BitBlt.SrcDC
element.short: The source Device Context.

element.name: TWidgetSet.BitBlt.XSrc
element.short: The origin in the source DC.

element.name: TWidgetSet.BitBlt.YSrc

element.name: TWidgetSet.CombineRgn
element.short: Combines two regions.

descr.p: The Destination must already be initialized. The Return value is the Region type for the Destination, or ERROR (0).
fnCombineMode can be one of:

dl.dd: Gets a region of all points which are in both source regions.
Gets an exact copy of the first source region.
Gets a region of all points which are in the first source region but not in the second.(Src1 - Src2).
Gets a region of all points which are in either the first source region or in the second.(Src1 + Src2).
Gets all points which are in either the first Source Region or in the second, but not in both.

element.name: TWidgetSet.CombineRgn.Result
element.short: The Destination's Region type, or ERROR (0).

element.name: TWidgetSet.CombineRgn.Dest
element.short: The Handle of the destination region. This region must already exist!

element.name: TWidgetSet.CombineRgn.Src1
element.short: The handle of a region to combine.

element.name: TWidgetSet.CombineRgn.Src2
element.short: The handle of a region to combine.

element.name: TWidgetSet.CombineRgn.fnCombineMode
element.short: How the regions are combined.

element.name: TWidgetSet.CreatePolygonRgn
element.short: Creates a polygonal region.

descr.p: The Points parameter is an array of points that give the vertices of the polygon. The connections between two points can cross others.

FillMode determines what points are going to be included in the region. When FillMode=Winding points are selected by using the Winding fill algorithm. When FillMode=ALTERNATE points are selected by using using the even-odd (alternative) fill algorithm.
The last point is connected to the first point to close the region.

element.name: TWidgetSet.CreatePolygonRgn.Result
element.short: The region Handle, zero on failure.

element.name: TWidgetSet.CreatePolygonRgn.Points
element.short: The array of points.

element.name: TWidgetSet.CreatePolygonRgn.NumPts
element.short: The number of points in Points.

element.name: TWidgetSet.CreatePolygonRgn.FillMode
element.short: Can be ALTERNATE or WINDING.

element.name: TWidgetSet.DrawFrameControl
element.short: Draws a window frame control, of the specified type and style.

descr.p: A window frame includes these components (uType):
Window managers do not normally allow the user to paint the components for a window frame, and do not supply a DC for that purpose.
The available features depend on the window manager for the platform, and the capabiities for the widgetset.

element.name: TWidgetSet.DrawFrameControl.Result
element.short: False on failure.

element.name: TWidgetSet.DrawFrameControl.DC
element.short: The window frame device context.

element.name: TWidgetSet.DrawFrameControl.uType
element.short: The control type, e.g. DFC_CAPTION.

element.name: TWidgetSet.DrawFrameControl.uState
element.short: The control state, e.g. DFCS_CAPTIONCLOSE (close button).

element.name: TWidgetSet.DrawFocusRect
element.short: Shows or hides a focus rectangle.

descr.p: This function is intended to temporarily outline part of a canvas, e.g. a rectangular selection following mouse moves (rubber banding box, DockRect).

A second call of the function, with the same parameters, removes the rectangle (XOR painting). Due to this behavior the frame should be removed before it might be overwritten by any other painting operation.
descr.remark: Not all platforms allow for painting outside WM_PAINT events.
Child windows may be excluded (clipped), i.e. the rectangle is not necessarily fully shown.

element.name: TWidgetSet.DrawFocusRect.Result
element.short: False on failure.

element.name: TWidgetSet.DrawFocusRect.DC
element.short: Almost a screen DC.

element.name: TWidgetSet.DrawEdge

element.name: TWidgetSet.DrawEdge.Result

element.name: TWidgetSet.DrawEdge.DC

element.name: TWidgetSet.DrawEdge.Rect

descr.p: Several formatting options are available for use in the Flags argument. The value correspond to the DrawText constants defined in the lcltype.pp unit.
DT_CALCRECT suppresses all painting, and calculates the extent for the formatted text returned in the Rect parameter.

element.name: TWidgetSet.DrawText.Rect
element.short: The bounding (clipping) rectangle.

element.name: TWidgetSet.DrawText.Flags
element.short: Formatting flags applied in the method.

An exact copy of the source region, same as SelectClipRGN.
All points which are in the Clipping Region but but not in the Source. (Clip - RGN).
All points which are in either the Clip Region or in the Source. (Clip + RGN).
All points which are in either the Clip Region or in the Source, but not in both.

element.name: TWidgetSet.FloodFill.FillStyle

element.name: TWidgetSet.FloodFill.Brush

The TCriticalSection type is platform specific. It is treated like a Handle.

element.name: TWidgetSet.Pie
element.short: Draws a filled pie-shaped wedge, from an ellipse and two radials.

descr.p: The ellipse is bounded by a rectangle x1..y2.

Each radial is defined by the center of the rectangle an point, which must not necessarily reside on the ellipse. The bounding arc goes counter-clockwise from the Start to the End radial. The pie is outlined with the current pen and filled with the current brush.

element.name: TWidgetSet.Pie.Result

element.name: TWidgetSet.PolyBezier
element.short: Draws Bezier curves.

descr.p: Use PolyBezier to draw cubic Bzier curves.
The first curve is drawn from the first point to the fourth point with the second and third points being the control points.
If the Continuous flag is True then each subsequent curve requires three more points, using the end-point of the previous Curve as its starting point.
If the Continuous flag is set to False, then each subsequent curve requires 4 additional points, which are used exactly as in the first curve.
If the Filled flag is set to True then a straight line is drawn from the last connected point to the starting point, and the entire curve is filled with the current brush.
Any additional points which do not add up to a full Bezier (4 for Continuous, 3 otherwise) are ignored. There must be at least 4 points to be connected.

element.name: TWidgetSet.PolyBezier.Result
element.short: False on failure.

element.name: TWidgetSet.PolyBezier.DC
element.short: The device context.

element.name: TWidgetSet.PolyBezier.Points
element.short: The array of points.

element.name: TWidgetSet.PolyBezier.NumPts
element.short: The number of points in Points.

element.name: TWidgetSet.PolyBezier.Filled
element.short: True draws a Polygon.

element.name: TWidgetSet.PolyBezier.Continuous
element.short: True uses the end-point as the starting point of the next segment.

element.name: TWidgetSet.Polygon
element.short: Draws a filled Polygon.

descr.p: Use Polygon to draw a closed, many-sided shape on the canvas, outlined with the current Pen and filled with the current Brush.
The Points parameter is an array of the vertices of the polygon.

Winding determines how the polygon is filled. When Winding is True, Polygon fills the shape using the Winding fill algorithm. When Winding is False, Polygon uses the even-odd (alternative) fill algorithm.
The first point is always connected to the last point.
To draw an unfilled polygon use the Polyline method, specifying the first point a second time at the end.

element.name: TWidgetSet.Polygon.Result
element.short: False on failure.

element.name: TWidgetSet.Polygon.DC
element.short: The device context.

element.name: TWidgetSet.Polygon.Points
element.short: The array of vertices.

element.name: TWidgetSet.Polygon.NumPts
element.short: The number of vertices.

element.name: TWidgetSet.Polygon.Winding
element.short: Selects the fill algorithm.

element.name: TWidgetSet.Polyline
element.short: Draws a sequence of lines.

descr.p: Use Polyline to connect a set of points on the canvas.
The Points parameter is an array of points to be connected. If you specify only two points, Polyline draws a single line.

Calling the MoveTo function with the value of the first point, and then repeatedly calling LineTo with all subsequent points will draw the same image on the canvas. Unlike LineTo, Polyline does not change the value of PenPos.

element.name: TWidgetSet.PostMessage
element.short: Sends a message to a window, without waiting for the message result.

descr.remark: This section was copied from LCLIntf, and may not apply to all platforms.
descr.p: This method is a thread-safe solution to send messages to windows. Those messages will be handled in the message loop of the application and therefore can be sent from any thread. They are not immediate, but they will awake the main thread if it is waiting for messages.
These messages can be handled by procedures with the keyword message in the class of a form for example. One would then use the handle of this form as the Handle parameter of this routine.
Custom messages should always have an identification number (represented by the parameter Msg) larger then the constant LM_USER.
The two parameters WParam and LParam will be passed along to the window together with the Msg identification number.

The difference between SendMessage and PostMessage is the way that they return control to the calling thread. With SendMessage control is not returned until the window that the message was sent to has completed processing the sent message, however with PostMessage control is returned immediately.

element.name: TWidgetSet.PostMessage.Result
element.short: Zero on failure.

element.name: TWidgetSet.PostMessage.Handle
element.short: The target window handle.

element.name: TWidgetSet.PostMessage.Msg
element.short: The message ID.

element.name: TWidgetSet.RedrawWindow
element.short: Redraws (part of) a window.

descr.p: All invalidated parts of a window, which deserve an update, are collected in the update region. When this region is not empty, WM_ERASEBKGND, WM_PAINT and WM_NCPAINT messages are sent to the window, as soon as the application is (almost) idle. RedrawWindow can be used to force an immediate redraw instead.
WM_ERASEBKGND is optional, erases the background before painting. WM_NCPAINT paints the non-client areas (borders, caption...), without assistance by user code.
When neither lprcUpdate nor hrgnUpdate are specified, the whole client area of the window is affected. Otherwise the region takes precedence over the rectangle.
Flags specify how the window is invalidated or validated, and when repainting occurs. Flags other than RDW_ERASE may not be supported by all platforms.
To invalidate specify RDW_INVALIDATE, and optionally one of:

dl.dd: Forces a WM_ERASEBKGND message before painting.
Also redraws the window frame, as covered by the update region.
Force WM_PAINT even if the update region is empty.

descr.p: Validation is not implemented for all platforms. To validate, specify RDW_VALIDATE and optionally one of the following:

dl.dd: Suppress all pending internal WM_PAINT messages.

descr.p: These flags specify when repainting will occur:
The handling of child windows normally depends on the WS_CLIPCHILDREN window style flag. Clipped child windows are not normally affected by RedrawWindow. These flags override:

element.name: TWidgetSet.AskUser
element.short: Displays a dialog box with the specified values, and returns the modal result.

descr.p: AskUser uses the native facilities provided by the platform or operating system to display a dialog, and captures the modal result value. This method is overridden in descendent class to implement the platform-specific dialog.

The implementation in TWidgetSet is used as a fallback when no other mechanism is available. It uses the routine assigned to QuestionDialogFunction to execute the dialog and capture the modal result value. No default actions are peformed when QuestionDialogFunction has not been assigned (contains Nil).

element.name: TWidgetSet.AskUser.Result
element.short: Modal result value for the dialog as a LongInt type.

element.name: TWidgetSet.AskUser.DialogCaption
element.short: Caption for the dialog.

element.name: TWidgetSet.AskUser.DialogMessage
element.short: Message text for the dialog.

element.name: TWidgetSet.AskUser.DialogType
element.short: Dialog type used to get an icon and flags used the dialog.

element.name: TWidgetSet.AskUser.Buttons
element.short: Collection with buttons for the dialog.

element.name: TWidgetSet.AskUser.HelpCtx
element.short: Help context used when F1 is pressed in the dialog.

element.name: TWidgetSet.CallDefaultWndHandler.Message

element.name: TWidgetSet.ExtUTF8Out
element.short: Draws an UTF-8 string without formatting (single line).

descr.p: The inter-character spacing array (Dx) must have one element for every Char (byte) in the UTF-8 text. For multi-byte character codes the values of all Dx elements are summed up.

element.name: TWidgetSet.ExtUTF8Out.Dx

element.name: TWidgetSet.ThemeServices
element.short: Theme services class instance for the widgetset.

descr.p: ThemeServices is a read-only property which provides access to the TThemeServices class instance for the platform. The value for the property is assigned in the CreateThemeServices method.

element.name: TWidgetSetClass
element.short: Class reference used to create new instance of the TWidgetSet class.

element.name: LCL_CAPABILITY_YES

element.short: Exception raised in the LCL interface.

element.name: EInterfaceCritical
element.short: Exception raised in the LCL interface.

element.name: EInterfaceWarning
element.short: Exception raised in the LCL interface.

element.name: WidgetSet
element.short: Provides access to the widgetset class instance for the platform.

descr.p: WidgetSet is a unit global TWidgetSet variable with the singleton used to access the widgetset class instance for the platform. WidgetSet contains a TWidgetSet descendant which implements the properties, methods, and events for a specific platform.
